materials.raw_text: P: 180 g (Palladium), Ru: 120 g (Ruthenium), Sc: 10 g (Scandium), Si: 10 g (Silicon), Tm: 10 g (Thulium)

sourcing.instructions: P: Specialty metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Ru: Specialty metal suppliers; Sc: Rare earth material suppliers; Si: Electronics or chemical suppliers; Tm: Rare earth material suppliers
steps: P: Specialty metal suppliers or online marketplaces; Ru: Specialty metal suppliers; Sc: Rare earth material suppliers; Si: Electronics or chemical suppliers; Tm: Rare earth material suppliers
6. Combine all measured metals in a clean, dry mixing container.
7. Use a mechanical mixer to ensure uniform blending of the powders for 5 minutes.
preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 180 g of Palladium. 
 2. Measure out 120 g of Ruthenium. 
 3. Measure out 10 g of Scandium. 
 4. Measure out 10 g of Silicon. 
 5. Measure out 10 g of Thulium. 
 6. Combine all measured metals in a clean, dry mixing container. 
 7. Use a mechanical mixer to ensure uniform blending of the powders for 5 minutes.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders to a suitable high-temperature furnace.
2. Heat to 1000°C at a rate of 10°C per minute.
3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and alloying of the components.
heating.raw_text:
1. Transfer the mixed powders to a suitable high-temperature furnace. 
 2. Heat to 1000°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 
 3. Maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure full melting and alloying of the components.

steps: 1. Gradually cool the furnace to room temperature at a rate of 5°C per minute.
2. Once cooled, allow the sample to rest in the furnace for an additional 1 hour to stabilize.
cooling.raw_text:
1. Gradually cool the furnace to room temperature at a rate of 5°C per minute. 
 2. Once cooled, allow the sample to rest in the furnace for an additional 1 hour to stabilize.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the furnace.
2. Use a diamond saw or grinder to achieve the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.
3. Sand down any rough edges using 400-grit sandpaper.
4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface finish and durability.
post_processing.raw_text:
1. Remove the solid sample from the furnace. 
 2. Use a diamond saw or grinder to achieve the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 
 3. Sand down any rough edges using 400-grit sandpaper. 
 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface finish and durability.
